discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The most likely data quality dimension applied in this scenario is B. Consistency.
Explanation:
Consistency refers to ensuring that data is the same across different instances or systems. This includes checking for discrepancies between datasets, redundant values, and uniform formatting. The modification described in the question likely involved correcting inconsistencies, such as updating outdated information or ensuring that values are presented uniformly.

Selected Answer: B
a pie chart would be most simple to understand from stake holder POV

B. A pie chart would be the best chart to use to identify the composition between the categories of the survey response data set. A pie chart is a circular chart that shows the proportions or percentages of a whole. Each slice of the pie represents a category, and the size of the slice represents the proportion or percentage of the total that belongs to that category. Pie charts are useful for showing the relative sizes of categories or for comparing the proportions of different categories. The other chart types (histogram, line, scatter plot, and waterfall) are not appropriate for showing the composition between categories.

Selected Answer: D
Range value is max value - min value , 14-1 = 13

questions.question_text: An analyst collected data that includes primary account numbers, expiration dates, and service codes. Which of the following data governance classifications is used to describe this data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. PCI
Explanation:
PCI
stands for "Payment Card Information" and refers specifically to data like primary account numbers, expiration dates, and service codes which are associated with credit cards.

questions.question_text:
Five dogs have the following heights in millimeters:
300, 430, 170, 470, 600
Which of the following is the mean height for the five dogs?

discussion.content: The mean height for the five dogs is 405mm. To calculate the mean, the heights of all the dogs are added together and then divided by the number of dogs. In this case, the heights of the five dogs are 300mm, 430mm, 170mm, 470mm, and 600mm, for a total of 2,270mm. When this total is divided by 5 (the number of dogs), the mean height is calculated to be 405mm.

comments.content: The mean height for the five dogs is 394mm. To calculate the mean, the heights of all the dogs are added together and then divided by the number of dogs. In this case, the heights of the five dogs are 300mm, 430mm, 170mm, 470mm, and 600mm, for a total of 1,970mm. When this total is divided by 5 (the number of dogs), the mean height is calculated to be 394mm.
